skill.name: ensembl-database
skill.description: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant analysis, comparative genomics, orthologs, VEP predictions, for genomic research.
skill.summary: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant a...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains a Python API client script that queries the official Ensembl REST API. The code has proper rate limiting, error handling, and only reads from network. No file writes, no credential access, no command execution beyond Python standard library.

content.value_statement: Researching genetic data requires navigating complex genomic databases. This skill provides a Python client to query Ensembl REST API for gene information, sequences, variants, and comparative genomics across 250+ species.
actual_capabilities: Look up gene information by symbol or Ensembl ID
Retrieve DNA, transcript, and protein sequences
Query genetic variants using rsID or coordinates
Find orthologs and paralogs across species
limitations: Requires internet connection to access Ensembl API
Rate limited to 15 requests per second for anonymous users
Cannot analyze local genomic files directly

use_cases.title: Gene annotation pipeline
use_cases.description: Look up genes, retrieve transcripts, get protein sequences, and find orthologs for cross-species comparison.

use_cases.title: Variant analysis workflow
use_cases.description: Query variants by rsID, predict functional consequences with VEP, and retrieve phenotype associations.

use_cases.title: Comparative genomics study
use_cases.description: Identify orthologs in target species, retrieve sequences, and analyze evolutionary conservation patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic gene lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the gene TP53 in the Ensembl database. Get its Ensembl ID, chromosome location, and transcript information.

prompt_templates.title: Sequence retrieval
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the genomic DNA sequence for the BRCA2 gene region from chromosome 13.

prompt_templates.title: Variant analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the variant rs699 using VEP. What are the predicted functional consequences?

prompt_templates.title: Cross-species comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Find mouse orthologs for human gene BRCA2. Compare their sequences and gene structures.

output_examples.input: Look up the gene CFTR and retrieve its protein sequence.
output: Gene: CFTR (Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Conductance Regulator)
Key domains: ABC transporter, two membrane-spanning domains

best_practices: Cache frequently accessed data to reduce API calls
Handle rate limiting by checking Retry-After headers
Use batch endpoints when querying multiple genes or variants
anti_patterns: Making individual requests in loops without rate limiting
Ignoring 429 errors instead of waiting and retrying
Not specifying genome assembly version for human queries

faq.question: Which species are supported?
faq.answer: Ensembl covers 250+ species including human, mouse, zebrafish, fruit fly, rat, and many vertebrates.

faq.question: How many API requests can I make?
faq.answer: Anonymous users are limited to 15 requests per second. Registered users can make up to 55,000 requests per hour.

faq.question: How do I query older genome assemblies?
faq.answer: Use https://grch37.rest.ensembl.org for GRCh37/hg19 queries. Current GRCh38 uses https://rest.ensembl.org.

faq.question: Is my query data stored or shared?
faq.answer: Queries go directly to Ensembl servers. No data is stored by this skill or shared with third parties.

faq.question: Why did my request fail with 404?
faq.answer: The gene symbol or Ensembl ID may not exist. Verify the identifier and species name spelling.

faq.question: How does this compare to Biomart?
faq.answer: Ensembl REST API provides programmatic access with rate limits. Biomart offers batch downloads but requires web interface or separate installation.
